poem:
### Forgiveness

In the shadow of ancient olive trees,  
pain takes root where bullets once spoke.  
A man rises, unshaken in his heart,  
paralyzed yet free, whispers of grace.  
His forgiveness, a stone set in the stream,  
ripples touching borders of old histories.  
In the quiet, peace germinates,  
in soil nourished by resilience.
